think_procedure: 1. Identify the knob 'log_min_duration_statement' in PostgreSQL. 2. Understand its function: it sets the minimum execution time above which statements will be logged. 3. Recognize that setting this knob to -1 disables logging of all statements, which is a special behavior compared to its regular operation of logging statements that exceed a certain duration. 4. Conclude that 'log_min_duration_statement' is a special knob because it has a special value (-1) that changes its functionality significantly.
